info.name: Alteryx Gallery API v2020.2
info.description:
The Gallery API is made up of 4 APIs: 

* Subscription API: Endpoints for users to interact with subscriptions, workflows, and schedules (jobs).
* User V2 API: Endpoints for users to interact with credentials, input files, and schedules (jobs).
* Admin V1 API: Endpoints for admins to fetch resources from the Admin interface.
* Admin V2 API: Version 2 of the endpoints for admins to fetch resources from the Admin interface.

Link to [help documentation](https://help.alteryx.com/current/developer-help/gallery-api-overview)

item.name: Subscription

The number of records to return.

The type of workflow to be returned, any of 0 (apps), 1(workflow), 2(macros).

query.description: The list of answers to execute the workflow with.

request.description: Queue an app execution job. Returns the ID of the job. Use the status request to get the results of the job.

request.description: Returns the jobs for the given Alteryx Analtytics App. Only app workflows can be used.

request.description: Returns the app that was requested.

item.description: Endpoints for users to interact with subscriptions, workflows, and schedules (jobs).

item.name: User V2

request.description: Finds credentials shared directly with users or via a Subscription.
Queue an app execution job. Returns the ID of the job. Must send **priority** via **values**.

item.description: Added in 2020.2. The new Gallery User V2 API exposes a way to pass workflow credentials. This allows users to start a workflow using a specific credential to which they have access.

item.name: Admin V1

request.description: This endpoint downloads the workflow as a YXZP file. This is Step 2 in the Migration process via API. See the Migration folder for the additional endpoints.

query.description: Valid values are: AppInfo, Collection, Credential, Subscription, User
The page number. Zero-based index.
The page size.

request.description:
Server tracks changes to these system entities:

- AppInfo (Workflow)
- Collection
- Credential
- Subscription
- User

query.description: The name of the workflow to filter on.
The starting date to filter on, inclusive.
The ending date to filter on, inclusive.
The page number to start. (Zero based)
Workflows per page. (Zero means return all)
Values: true, false

request.description: Return all workflows, optionally filtered by date.

item.description: Version 2 of the endpoints for admins to fetch resources from the Admin interface.

item.name: Migration

query.description: comma seperated list of subscriptions to filter by

request.description:
Get a list of workflows ready to migrate. Include a comma-separated list of subscriptionIds as a query parameter. Subscription IDs identify a specific studio.

The return is an array of workflows marked as ready to migrate under the specified subscription (studio). If you do not provide `subscriptionsIds`, the return includes all workflows marked as ready to migrate. The return includes 3 properties: `appId`, the currently published `revisionId`, and the `subscriptionID` the workflow belongs to.

Full help documentation [here](https://help.alteryx.com/current/developer-help/gallery-api-migratable-endpoint)

query.description: comma seperated list of subscriptions to filter by
The filename of the new workflow.
The new workflow name.
The owner of the migrated workflow. The email address must exist in the target environment.
Flag to validate the workflow upon migrating to the target environment.
Flag to set the workflow to public to show in “My Company’s Gallery” in the target environment.

This is the Source environment appId of the to-be-migrated workflow. If a workflow with the same sourceId exists, this replaces that workflow in the target environment. Otherwise, a new workflow will be generated.
(Send an empty string if you do not wish to specify an appID.)

Add a worker tag to the workflow to have a specific worker to run the workflow. 

(Send an empty string if you do not wish to specify worker.)
Flag to set the workflow as available for download by other users in the target environment.

request.description:
This endpoint publishes the downloaded workflow to the target environment.

Full help documentation [here](https://help.alteryx.com/current/developer-help/gallery-api-migratable-endpoint)

(Optional) If you want, you can use the `migratable` endpoint to toggle the **This workflow is ready to be migrated** setting on a workflow back to **No** in the source environment after workflow migration in the target environment.

Full help documentation [here](https://help.alteryx.com/current/developer-help/gallery-api-migratable-endpoint)

item.description:
Use the migratable endpoint to migrate workflows across Server environments. You can use this to manage workflow deployments during development and testing phases.

To begin, enable workflows for migration on the Workflows page of the Gallery Admin interface. Once you mark workflows for migration, follow these steps to publish them from the source environment into the appropriate subscription (studio) of a target environment.
